citations.narrative:
There are nine total bags of expired feed bags intermingled with non-expired feed bags:
One bag of Guinea Pig Diet intended for consumption by two adult capybaras and eight bags of Insectivore diet intended
for consumption by two adult bat-eared foxes and one adult four-toed hedgehog. When the inspector called this to the
attention of the zoo director, the expired feed was removed for disposal by employees during the inspection.
Expired food can have decreased nutritive value and palatability, which can be detrimental to the health of the animals
that consume it. The licensee must ensure that all food is wholesome, palatable and free from contamination and of
sufficient quantity and nutritive value to maintain all animals in good health.
CORRECTED AT THE TIME OF THIS INSPECTION CONDUCTED ON NOVEMBER 14, 2024

The heating fixtures in the primary enclosures of one adult male Chihuahuan raven and one adult male barn owl have
electrical wires and heating bulbs that are accessible to the birds. Hot bulbs and unshielded electrical wires pose a risk for
injury to the birds. The licensee must ensure that primary enclosures are constructed and maintained so that they protect
the birds from injury.
TO BE CORRECTED BY NOVEMBER 22, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.129(a) 
   
Feeding. 
There are nine total bags of expired feed bags intermingled with non-expired feed bags:  
One bag of Guinea Pig Diet intended for consumption by two adult capybaras and eight bags of Insectivore diet intended 
for consumption by two adult bat-eared foxes and one adult four-toed hedgehog. When the inspector called this to the 
attention of the zoo director, the expired feed was removed for disposal by employees during the inspection. 
Expired food can have decreased nutritive value and palatability, which can be detrimental to the health of the animals 
that consume it. The licensee must ensure that all food is wholesome, palatable and free from contamination and of 
sufficient quantity and nutritive value to maintain all animals in good health. 
CORRECTED AT THE TIME OF THIS INSPECTION CONDUCTED ON NOVEMBER 14, 2024 
3.153(a)(1)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The heating fixtures in the primary enclosures of one adult male Chihuahuan raven and one adult male barn owl have 
electrical wires and heating bulbs that are accessible to the birds. Hot bulbs and unshielded electrical wires pose a risk for 
injury to the birds. The licensee must ensure that primary enclosures are constructed and maintained so that they protect 
the birds from injury. 
TO BE CORRECTED BY NOVEMBER 22, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
